# Command Standard Operating Procedure ## C-1 Commanding Officers [bold]C-1-A[/bold] - The Commanding Officer holds final decision making authority on all matters onboard the station. Central Command may revoke this title and its authority from any person, for any reason.
[bold]C-1-B[/bold] - The Executive Officer must ensure the Commanding Officer acts within the spirit of the law and is trusted to enact the orders of the CO, holding but with the approval of their authority, in an emergency situation.
[bold]C-1-C[/bold] - In the event the Commanding Officer is incapacitated or removed, the Executive Officer will assume the position of Commanding Officer.
[bold]C-1-D[/bold] - The Captain assumes the responsibilities of CO barring extenuating circumstances. The CO will designate a member of command as Executive officer, XO. If there is no CO, Command must vote and reach consensus on a new CO and inform Central Command. If there is no Command, Central Command must be immediately informed.
## C-2 Succession Chain - Captain - Executive Officer - Head of Personnel - Head of Security - Research Director - Chief Medical Officer - Quartermaster - Chief Engineer - Warden - Senior Security Officer
## C-3 Responsibilities [bold]C-3-A[/bold] - It is the CO’s responsibility to ensure the continued function of the station and resolve disputes when necessary.
[bold]C-3-B[/bold] - The Commanding Officer is responsible for securing the nuclear authentication disk and arming the nuclear fission explosive if necessary. The nuclear authentication disk should remain secure on the CO’s person at all times.
[bold]C-3-C[/bold] - Heads of staff are entrusted with the responsibility of leading and operating their respective departments.
## C-4 Demotion of the Commanding Officer - The CO can be demoted at any time with a majority vote amongst Command. The CO is not allowed to vote, nor are they allowed to perform any intervention intended to prevent the vote. A vote is started upon a Command member’s request. Regardless of the outcome, Central Command is notified.
## C-5 Demotions - Heads of Staff may freely demote members of their own department without the approval or oversight of any other Command member. The CO may demote any crew member at their own discretion but they are heavily encouraged to receive the corresponding Head of Staff’s approval.
